;Tang Xiaofeng: "What is Historical Geography", Beijing Sanlian Bookstore, September 2023

;

;
;

;

;Based on his profound knowledge and sharp eyesight, the author focuses on specific and unique Commentary method is used to tell the history of the formation and development of this subject branch; (more than two-fifths of the book, but not too much) ;. From the perspective of "raising questions is more important than solving them", he summarized a number of enlightening problem areas arising from the development of this field following the path of modern geography. The whole book uses a narrative method that is completely different from that of textbooks, painting a vivid intellectual portrait of historical geography on the page.

;

;This book is written very emotionally, so it can easily shorten the distance with ordinary readers. Witnessing Hou Renzhi taking out a few soil samples from the archaeological ash pit and taking them away, the author "suddenly felt that something called science suddenly appeared." He used Zhang Chengzhi's words, "If I had read this book earlier, I would have taken the postgraduate entrance exam for him" to recreate the academic impact of Shi Nianhai's "Collection of Rivers and Mountains". He pointed out how important it is for Chinese historical geography to be recognized by Tan Qixiang, who has the trust of first-class academic scholars in the field of historical documents. He also said that Skinner's assertion that traditional China had "no nationwide urban system" first made him "stunned", but then, "of course I immediately realized that Skinner was talking about economics, not politics."

;

;I have always thought that the emergence of the Yugong School from the field of ancient history analysis meant the formation of modern historical geography in China. However, this book regards it as just a "transitional state" and takes the emergence of the "new paradigm with geography as its ontology" in the 1950s as a sign of the "creation" of this branch of the discipline. This understanding, including whether historical geography has really been "geographicalized" today, and whether it should be "geographicalized" across the board, still deserves further discussion. The "geographicalization" of historical geography and the "humanities" of geography may reflect the increasingly multidisciplinary nature of modern scholarship.

;

;If you ask, is there anyone in contemporary academia who maintains the magnanimous, elegant, and gentle academic gentlemanly demeanor? The first thing I think of is Tang Xiaofeng. This book deepened my impression. Professor Munro Shida asked, and I also claimed a topic in the "What is..." series of Ledo Library, but I always felt that I couldn't write it. After reading this book, I finally feel a little confident.

;

;;

;

;
;;

;Peter Singer: "The Important Things in Life: 72 Lessons in Ethics", translated into Chinese by Wang Xin, Guangxi Normal University Press, April 2023

;

;Limit value rational judgment exclusively to the scope of demonstration of the legitimacy of moral intentions, and rely entirely on instrumental rationality to "scientifically" achieve the above Intention, doing so is likely to blur our ethical horizons. The more prosperous science becomes, the more society needs ethics.

;

;This book is a collection of short comments published by the author in newspaper columns over the years. "The limit of one thousand words" forced him "to write in a clear and concise style." What it focuses on are the confusions or dilemmas that ordinary people face in their daily lives in contemporary society: Is morality progressing? What is a good life? When should charity be shown to someone who has made a mistake? If narcotics are recognized to shorten lifespan, should they still be used to suppress pain? Should we live a thousand years? Can public figures have a private life? Is open diplomacy possible? Some readers may feel that the author has not provided any "substantive conclusions" on questions such as this. That may be precisely because we are too familiar with another way of discussion, which can give a decisive and only correct answer to any question.

;

;A book that talks about ethics to the public can be written without looking like a boring sermon with a straight face. Our skills in this area are far from perfect. However, the subtitle of the translation still evokes the feeling of sitting upright between the narrow desks and chairs. It would be better to literally translate the title of the book as "Ethics in the Real World: 72 Short Essays Related to It", which may be more in line with the purpose of the original book.

;

;;

;

;
;;

;Li Tiangang: "Memory of the Ages: The Shaping of Modern Chinese Ideology", Renmin University of China Press, July 2023

; < p style="text-align: left;">;The earliest article I read included in this collection was "1900: The Restless South." I remember that I called Brother Tiangang very excitedly at that time, hoping that he would write a few more articles on this "Centennial Commemoration", and that when they were accumulated, they could be compiled and published. But meaningful "hundred years" are rare, and there are still some that are inconvenient to write about. The "Reminiscence of the Year" compiled before my eyes can be regarded as a common one.

;

;Compared with many other books on similar topics, how can this book uncover so many new insights worthy of our deep thought? The key is whether you start from a bunch of ready-made presuppositions and pretend to interpret history, or do you go back to the scene and examine it from scratch? In fact, we cannot return to the historical scene. However, as long as you are willing, you can still "see" that period of history as empathetically as possible through the various records left by people at that time. "The devil is in the details." To give an example that is not included in this book: Wang Kaiyun recalled the "painful history" of the burning of the Old Summer Palace. Why did he call that fire "Lishan Fire"? Not all ignored details are so important, but some solid and reliable details can really become "devils" that change established perceptions!

;

;Another century-old elegy in the book is "1905: The Disillusionment of the Imperial Examination System". The abolition of the imperial examination not only broke the backbone of traditional Chinese society, but also allowed "dispersed scholar-bureaucrats to pervasively penetrate into all strata of society, exacerbating the turmoil across the country." The author has the same view as Professor Yang Guoqiang, who strongly emphasizes that modern Chinese society suffered from "tenon removal".

;

;;

;

;
;< /p>;

;Li Jianming: "The Mainstream of Political Culture during the Founding of the United States", The Commercial Press, July 2023

;

;Americans are brave enough to open up a "noisy" discussion on how to view the system of their country's founding. In this regard, the author of this book uses more than a thousand pages to develop a response and rethinking full of ideological tension based on his own life experience. There are not enough people to comment on "Douban Reading", but the readers who left short comments all gave five stars.

;

;The so-called "mainstream" must have received countless tributaries along both sides of the river, making the water mixed with mud and sand; but it must also form the same giant current rushing forward. . During the American Revolution, the power elite and the radical masses distrusted each other and struggled with each other, even causing turmoil and rebellion in local society. Different from many self-proclaimed political science studies that always try to explain political struggles in terms of power, selfish desires and the pursuit of maximizing interests, and regard the pursuit of values ​​as just a fig leaf for seizing power and maximizing interests, the author emphasizes that it is the two sides’ mutual opposition to The common belief in popular sovereignty and republican principles prevented the American Revolution from becoming a story of a life-and-death struggle between good and evil, but instead became a witness to the initial establishment of modern democracy.

;

;Chapter 5 "Reconstruction of the Concept of 'Democracy'" is particularly worthy of careful reading. The British Revolution promoted constitutionalism but did not talk about democracy. Therefore, Americans need to rediscover the value of democracy as "a dangerous and even insulting label." This reminds me of Xu Fuguan’s opinion about the people’s “foolishness but spirituality”: “From the perspective of the knowledge level of intellectuals, the people are foolish. But in terms of their ability to judge big rights and wrongs, good and bad, the people are superior to intellectuals.… Therefore, Confucianism believes that people’s likes and dislikes derived from judgments of right and wrong can be trusted."

;

;;< /p>;

;Shao Xiaofeng: "Song Style Artistic Life", Shanghai Literature and Art Publishing House, September 2023

;

;After China emerged from the "medieval era" during the Tang and Song Dynasties, did it enter its "pre-modern era"? Experts have mixed opinions on this. But they may all agree that the Song Dynasty, especially the Southern Song Dynasty, is a not-too-distant past that ordinary Chinese can directly perceive based on their real-life experience.

;

;The topic selection of this book is therefore very down-to-earth, the writing is relaxed but not frivolous, and it is profound but not esoteric. It is not about the art of the Song Dynasty itself, but the Song people's taste in art and their art of life, that is, the artistic orientation and aesthetic taste contained in daily life shared by many social strata at that time. The whole book uses seven theme words to connect fifty essays, focusing on the small and big things. Although it cannot be said that it has achieved the effect of "gathering armpits into fur", it is not too much to say that it uses auspicious light feathers of different colors to connect a picture of the night sky.

; Mon, 27 Nov 2023 16:25:05 +0800 看网络短剧的人：“成功来得那么简单，爱情也是”http://www.infzm.com/contents/261395
;;2023-11-27 12:00:00;
;

;He is a CEO with a net worth of hundreds of millions. One day in coffee While discussing business in the hall, he was mistaken for a blind date by a girl who made a living by running a street vendor. Out of interest in the girl, the president had a flash marriage with her. He hid his true identity from the girl, and the girl always thought that her husband was just an ordinary worker, and she still worked hard to earn money by setting up a stall.

;

;As the plot develops, the identity of the CEO is exposed, and a past relationship also surfaces - it turns out that the CEO and the girl had a child five years ago due to a chance encounter. It’s just that the president didn’t know it, and the girl also forgot due to amnesia...

;

;In August 2023, this movie will feature boss tyrants, flash marriages, amnesia, sweet pets, and... The short drama "After the Flash Wedding, Mr. Fu Can't Hide His Vest", which combines elements such as love after marriage, was launched. In just 24 hours, the recharge of the drama exceeded 20 million yuan, becoming a "hot hit" in the short drama market.

;

;;

;

;Cover covers of some mini program short dramas, including "After the Flash Wedding, Mr. Fu Can't Hide His Vest". Data map

;

;"The concept of the hit drama we make is at least 20 million yuan." Yan Peiliang, the director of the show, told Southern Weekend reporters, "We are now a hit hit. The rate is almost 90%." Yan Peiliang's short play creation began in 2021, and has currently filmed more than a dozen popular short plays.

;

;Online micro-series, usually a single episode lasts from tens of seconds to about 15 minutes, and the number of episodes ranges from a dozen to hundreds of episodes, mainly including Short dramas on long video platforms mainly based on Youku, iQiyi, Mango, Tencent, etc., short dramas on short video platforms mainly on Douyin, Kuaishou, etc., and "mini program short dramas" that are "parasitic" on WeChat and others.

;

;;

;

;Part of the cover of Douyin short drama. Data map

;

;Detawen's "Micro Short Drama Market Report for the First Half of 2023" shows that in the first half of 2023, a total of 481 new micro short dramas will be released, which has exceeded The number of new releases in 2022 (454). On November 22, the "2023-2024 China Micro-Short Drama Market Research Report" released by iiMedia Consulting showed that China's online micro-short drama market size will be 37.39 billion yuan in 2023, a year-on-year increase of 267.65%. Overseas, according to media reports, ReelShort, a short drama application platform owned by Chinese Online, has topped the U.S. iOS entertainment list.

;

;What supports the new trend of short dramas is the huge number of viewers. The "China Online Audiovisual Development Research Report (2023)" shows that as of December 2022, the number of short video users in China has reached 1.012 billion, of which more than half of the short video users have watched micro-short dramas and instant noodles that are less than 3 minutes in length. etc., the viewing proportion of users aged 19 and under exceeds 50%. In August 2023, data released by Kuaishou also showed that the number of people interested in short dramas on Kuaishou exceeded 260 million.

;

;In just one or two hours, the audience traveled through the various fun spots that were set, experiencing rebirth, sudden wealth, and reverse. Attack, slap in the face, revenge and other various virtual lives. In this short drama world, they can easily gain a perfect love and reach the other side of success effortlessly.

;

;“What is needed is simplicity, speed and directness”

;

;Qiao Wei used to play otome games (note: those targeting women Dating simulation game), I watched the short drama in August. She is 39 years old and works as a training supervisor in a company. The first short drama she watched was a clip automatically recommended by a short video platform. The plot was simple: the heroine had to find someone to get married because of various grievances between wealthy families. She mistakenly thought that the male protagonist was the president at the construction site. He was an ordinary worker. After marrying him, the two started a life of marriage first and love later.

;

;Qiao Wei watched it for more than a minute. Her first impression was of handsome men and beautiful women. She thought the theme of "The Domineering President Falls in Love with Me" was interesting. After searching for the full collection Then they gave chase. To her surprise, the short drama had a compact plot and no unnecessary plot. She finished it in just over an hour. After that, she started looking for short dramas recommended by other netizens.

;

;During a busy working day, Qiao Wei only has lunch break and two hours before going to bed. For her, the length of short dramas is just right. Even if there are more than a hundred episodes of short dramas, it only takes an hour or two to finish them all. During her lunch break, she would randomly open a movie and watch a dozen or twenty episodes, which lasted only about twenty minutes, as a pastime. "Anyway, my time is fragmented."

;

;The scene of Tan Zhifeng watching the short play is also similar. She is completing her third year of master's degree this year and will watch short dramas in her spare time. However, she usually doesn't go out of her way to find short dramas recommended by others. She just watches the ones that appeal to her. She would even watch short dramas at double speed. "The main reason is that she doesn't have enough time and is anxious, so she wants to finish it as soon as possible." Moreover, "each scene of the short drama does not contain such complicated information," so double speed does not affect it.

;

;According to her observation, short dramas generally rely on dialogue between actors to advance the plot. The president may sit on a chair and communicate with the butler next to him. Once the matter is done, "you can move on to the next step." There are not so many details to explore in the short play, such as what traditional elements the set is designed according to, and what information is conveyed by the actors' movements and eyes.

;

;Tan Zhifeng used to read online articles for more than ten years. When she first saw some clips from short dramas, she thought they were "tacky". Those settings, such as "The Overlord and His Little Wife," were all popular elements in online articles more than ten years ago. But she didn't expect that now she is chasing short dramas. During the play, I still felt like I was "on top".

;

;;

;

;Stills from the online short drama "The President Loves Me Too Much". Data map

;

;She thinks this may be related to the simplicity and directness of the short play. For example, she wants to watch "The Boss's Sweet Pet". In some TV dramas, it may take a long development process to reach the plot point of "pet", but the short drama is different. It will directly use the plot scene of "pet, love hard". Presented; another example is the plot of a slap in the face. A long drama may take a long time to prepare, but a short drama may reveal the conspiracy of the vicious female supporting character in the next episode and slap the face immediately.

;

;"Instead of waiting for an hour for that one (cool) point, why don't I look at 10 (cool) points in 5 minutes. Although it looks tacky, But it’s refreshing faster.” Tan Zhifeng told Southern Weekend reporters, “What everyone needs is simple, fast and direct.”

;

;Mo Xia also thinks so. She is 28 years old and works in a public institution. She remembered a costume-themed short drama she had watched before. There was a plot where the heroine changed her face, and no one except the hero could recognize her. She felt that if this plot was placed in a long drama, there would definitely be misunderstandings that would take several episodes to complete, which would make people feel frustrated. However, in the short drama, “There are no misunderstandings, it’s just a very smooth plot, and everyone just It was fun to watch.”

;

;"I don't care what the two people in the middle have gone through, I just want to see them reconcile." Qiao Wei said. In her opinion, long dramas will always try to be logically linked, but "there will still be logical gaps." Short dramas are less concerned with logic. "(Since) it's not perfect, I might as well show more of what I want to see."

;

;"Provide us with material for dreaming"

;

;Like online articles, short dramas are also divided into "gender". "Mainly serving male audiences, the audience of "Female Channel Drama" is mainly female. Li Yu is currently mainly writing "male dramas". He has created eighty or ninety short plays, most of which have themes such as the God of War and the son-in-law. He introduced that the audience of "male video drama" is mainly between the ages of 35 and 55. Most of them work as security guards, delivery workers, online ride-hailing drivers, etc., and their educational level is generally low.

;

;Yan Peiliang, who currently mainly produces "female video dramas", said that "female video dramas" are more like romantic dramas, usually with elements such as sweet pets and sadomasochism. "Male dramas" are more delicate, and the age of the audience is relatively young, mainly between 25 and 45 years old. These women usually have a certain level of education and pay more attention to the picture, atmosphere and other factors of the short drama.

;

;But in Yan Peiliang's view, whether it is a "male video drama" or a "female video drama", most viewers will substitute themselves when watching. Female viewers may fantasize about a handsome guy pursuing them, while male viewers may assume the identity of the male protagonist and feel that they are "counterattacking" and "getting rich".

;

;He observed that unlike female audiences who have high requirements for the appearance of the male and female protagonists in "female-channel dramas", male audiences watch "male-channel dramas" ", the requirements for the male protagonist's appearance are not high, just ordinary. Too good-looking will affect their acceptance. But at the same time, they hope that the heroine will be as beautiful as possible, so that "the fantasy can be fulfilled."

;

;As a short play writer and director, Zhizhu pays more attention to creating a sense of atmosphere when filming, so that the audience can better relate to it. She is a photographer and started filming short plays in early 2022. Now her two short plays have received ratings of 6.8 and 7.2 respectively on Douban. She will work hard on lighting and composition, and create a sense of atmosphere by arranging scenes such as rain and wind. Sometimes she will also create a sense of tension through the gazes of the male and female protagonists as needed.

;

;;

;

;Stills from the online short series "Donglan Snow". Data map

;

;"Actually, everyone has a dream about love in their hearts. I think the short drama invisibly provides us with material for dreaming." Qiao Wei told Southern Weekend reporter.

;

;She always calls herself a "middle-aged girl". In reality, she has a happy small family, and her son is already in the first grade of elementary school. But she feels that "the reality is You are who you are, and you will never be the heroine in 'The Boss Falls in Love with Me', but when you watch the show, you can realize such a dream."

;

;Qian Wan is 27 years old and works in a bank. When watching short dramas, he prefers the plot of "chasing his wife in the crematorium". For example, the male protagonist originally had a "Bai Yueguang", but he abandoned the female protagonist after Bai Yueguang came back. After experiencing some things, he realized that the person he really loved was the heroine, thus starting the "crematorium" mode. She felt that this might be related to her only real love experience.

;

;That relationship was pursued by her, and it only lasted for more than ten days. The other party admitted to her during a phone call that he still liked the girl he had not pursued before. Qian Wan felt that she had been tricked by the other party, and she was unwilling and sad. At that time, she really hoped that the boy would regret it, but she sent a message to the other party at that time, but the other party did not reply.

;

;"Aren't (these) dramas just for dreaming?" Qian Wan said. Ren Dongxiao also thinks so. She is a sophomore this year. When watching short dramas, every time she sees the heroine being bullied and the CEO hero standing up to protect and take care of the heroine and slapping other people in the face, she expects it to really exist in reality. Such a person.

;

;Qiao Wei remembered watching "Tom and Jerry" when she was a child. No matter how much Tom was tortured by Jerry, he could not get enough of Jerry. This made her very happy. Peace of mind is a joy. Watching short dramas gave her a similar feeling. The villain's thoughts were always on his face. No matter how he framed the heroine, the hero would always appear at the critical moment. No matter how many twists and turns the hero and heroine went through, there was always a positive outcome. "Everything you hope will happen happens, everything you hope to see will be seen," she said.

;

;In Tan Zhifeng’s view, many short dramas will deliberately omit complicated things in real life. For example, if an 18th-tier star becomes a movie queen, the middle part should be It’s a long road, but in the short play, “you can get all the fame and achievements you want without putting in any effort”; no matter what the heroine’s conditions are or how she behaves, the CEO is devoted to her for no reason. . "Success comes so easily, and so does love." She said, "(These) things that make no sense if you think about it carefully may just be a dream created for everyone."

;

;"Maybe this kind of thing "Happiness can't be found in the elegant hall, but it doesn't matter"

;

;Li Yu currently writes mainly "small program short plays". He is 20 years old and can write two pieces a month. Three parts, each with about 100 episodes. The four short plays he wrote in the past two months are "60% similar in content", and they are all based on the same God of War theme. The protagonist may be a fish seller in this drama, but next time he will be a pig butcher; some of the key slap-in-the-face plots will take place at the old man's birthday party, and some will be at the heroine's home.

;

;Li Yu doesn't want his friends to know that he is writing a short play, for fear that they will think, "It turns out that such rubbish stuff was written by people like you." . He would feel "very ashamed" and "(the short play he wrote) has no nutrition, literary value or artistic value", but "currently they (editors and platforms) do not want to innovate and do not require taking risks", and he also needs to survive .

;

;"Short plays inherently have many similar plots. (If you) often watch short plays, you will find that many characters have similar names and cannot be distinguished at all." Many short dramas currently on the market do not have the so-called film and television language. "To put it bluntly, it is a dynamic PPT for online novels." Yan Peiliang told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;Mo Xia said that she "can remember very few". She has watched nearly fifty short plays this year, and she can name the titles and general plots of them. No more than ten. Other short drama viewers interviewed also mentioned that it was difficult to remember which short dramas they had watched. Tan Zhifeng recalled a certain short drama he had watched before, and what he remembered more was the short drama elements of "traveling through the past, empress, queen, CEO, sweet pet, counterattack and slap in the face".

;

;"I can only say that this kind of short play is excitement itself. No matter how it is produced, it only meets some momentary needs for happiness. Maybe this kind of happiness even reaches the top of the screen. It’s not elegant, but it doesn’t matter.” Tan Zhifeng told Southern Weekend reporters. Just like herself, she is busy and stressed in real life, and she hopes to focus on watching things in her spare time that do not require the use of her brain. "You can't keep one string tight all the time."

;

;;

;

;Stills from the online short series "Abuse of Love: Mr. Lu's Newly Married Mute Wife". Data map

;

;Qiao Wei attaches great importance to the two hours of free time before going to bed. For her, "If I didn't have these two hours, I would either be a As a wife, either a mother or an employee, I have to think about how to live a better life. (But) I feel that only when these two hours belong to myself, (will I) consider whether I am happy or not. I It doesn’t matter who it is, I don’t have to work hard or think.”

;

;She feels that the short play is “quite efficient” in terms of satisfying her own needs for happiness. . She used to spend those two hours playing games where she could design her own plot, or learning to play the ukulele. Although she was happy, she still found it too mentally taxing. "The short play feels like a popping candy to me. I've finished it in one bite. I don't need to think about it. I just feel happy now. As for whether it is meaningful or not, I don't think it's important."

;

;But she also feels that if there is no short drama, it will not have much impact. Zhizhu also believes that even if there is no short drama, there will be something else, because everyone is very tired from work, and there must always be some entertainment channels for emotional release. Games, short videos, and novels can all be options. "( Short plays) are very alternative for the audience."

;

;Yan Peiliang feels that although short plays are "dispensable" for some audiences. But just like Coke, some people think it is dispensable, and there will always be people who regard it as a necessity. "Let the audience choose for themselves." For example, a breakfast shop sells steamed buns and provides side dishes. Some people buy the steamed buns and leave, while others just pick them up. Some dried radishes and pickles, "The value of our existence is that when the audience has this demand, we still have some relatively good quality pickles waiting for them."

;

; Mon, 27 Nov 2023 15:25:03 +0800 离婚跟拍火了，闲得慌还是花钱买仪式感？http://www.infzm.com/contents/261363
;;2023-11-27 15:00:00;
;

;Recently, divorce follow-up photography has become popular among young people. When they get divorced, many young people put aside the past haze and choose to follow the divorce and hold a divorce party.

;

;At the divorce party, the banner read: "This is the end of this B marriage." Blogger Sushi said, "I think marriage has a corresponding sense of ceremony, and divorce also needs it."

;

;;

;

;;(Visual China/Picture );

;

;;Photography of marriage and filming of divorce;

;

;Data shows that China’s divorce rate has increased year by year since 2003, reaching its peak in 2019 at 3.4‰. In the past two years, it has also remained above 2‰. Among them, young people aged 25-35 have become the main force in divorce.

;

;Under this trend, young people's attitudes and thoughts when facing divorce have changed greatly compared with the past. Compared with the bitterness and hatred of the older generation, divorce seems to be becoming a "peaceful thing" and a positive thing.

;

;In fact, as early as the 2010 movie "If You Are the One 2", Mango, played by Yao Chen, and Li Xiangshan, played by Sun Honglei, held a party when they separated. Divorce ceremony. Actor Ge You, as the divorce certifier, said in his speech: "Let's shake hands like acquaintances," which brought a relatively happy ending to the separation between the two.

;

;Today's young people use the method of divorce follow-up, taking photos and Vlog to record the end of one stage and the beginning of a new stage. Taking photos becomes a ritual in the divorce process. Of course, this ceremonial divorce photoshoot is completely different from the wedding photoshoot.

;

;As we all know, when taking wedding photos, the theme is to get married and the main focus is celebration. Almost every newlywed couple will wear Chinese or Western-style dresses and hire professional photo studios and photographers to record the two people as a couple cuddling with each other and being united forever in various settings such as the seaside, under the shadow of coconut trees, and in the courtyard of an ancient house. The beautiful shadow.

;

;But divorce photos are no longer carefully posed on the beach or in the shadow of coconut trees, but may be the Civil Affairs Bureau or a place where the two went shopping together, or even A certain park or tea house for daily simple photography. After photographer Song Yang accepted an order to follow up on the divorce of an old classmate, he followed his friends to several places that were memorable to them.

;

;During the process, Song Yang followed silently and did not find a special camera position to capture the scene. He only occasionally gave simple guidance to the subjects. The overall atmosphere was not heavy and similar to normal. life portraits. Song Yang said, "It's like shooting with normal friends. Everyone is calm, no conflicts, and not too close. And it's more casual, without even discussing in advance where to shoot and how to shoot."

;

;In addition to the final group photo, other divorce photos also include a photo of a girl who came to a coffee shop after the divorce and took a photo with a coffee cup with "Happy Single" written on it. . The scenes and shots are not complicated, but with this simple stroke, the divorce was brought to an end.

;

;; < /p>;

; ; (visual China/picture) ;

;

; ; Why do young people want to take divorce ;

;

; So why do young people want to take divorce photos when they divorce? First of all, of course, because the divorce incident occurred. With this incident, many comprehensive factors behind this have begun to work.

;

; At present, the development process of society has entered a new stage. Marriage is becoming a lifetime from traditional concepts to Freedom of choice. The impact of traditional concepts on young people is weakening, and young people have begun to pay more attention to their personal rights and feelings.

;

;The financial industry is entering a big model moment.

;

;On November 6, 2023, China Merchants Union Finance and Sun Yat-sen University jointly developed and launched the first 13 billion parameter open source large model in the consumer finance industry-"China Merchants Union Smart Deer". This is the fourth public large-scale model of the consumer finance industry after Du Xiaoman, Masha Consumption and Ant Financial.

;

;In fact, traditional financial institutions are also accelerating the application of large models. Some large technology companies are looking to cooperate with financial institutions. The “battle of hundreds of models” in the financial industry is in full swing.

;

;How effective is the implementation of large-scale financial models? What are the challenges? What impact will it have on the future financial ecosystem?

;

;To this end, researchers from the Southern Weekend New Finance Research Center investigated various mainstream financial institutions, tested the apps of various financial institutions, and reviewed the speeches of guests at major professional forums in 2023. They found that in the second half of 2023, financial institutions will accelerate Lay out large-scale models, and the main application areas are intelligent customer service, investment strategies, risk control, investment consulting and investment education, etc.

;

;But currently, cooperation between technology companies and financial institutions is the mainstream model. In this cooperation, financial institutions are not only worried about the business effects of large models, but also have concerns about data security and compliance.

;

;Researchers at the Southern Weekend New Finance Research Center believe that large models in the financial industry are still in the trial and promotion stage, but the trend is irreversible. A researcher at Southern Weekend's New Finance Research Center put forward three suggestions for this: promoting "industry-university-research" collaboration, accelerating legislation, and paying attention to talent training.

;

;;Financial large models are blooming everywhere;

;

;What is special about financial large models? The authoritative international artificial intelligence magazine "Nature Machine Intelligence" believes that large models refer to "deep learning pre-training algorithms" with parameter scales reaching more than 100 million levels. General-purpose large models require huge computing resources and data volumes, and require extremely high technical teams and financial support. They are key projects for major domestic and foreign technology companies.

;

;The vertical domain model focuses on specific industries, fields or scenarios. Therefore, large models in vertical fields have relatively low requirements for computing power and algorithms, but have higher requirements for data in specific fields. Financial large models are typical large models in vertical fields. As a modern high-end service industry, the financial industry has the characteristics of huge data volume and rich scenarios, which is naturally consistent with the large model's demand for massive high-quality data. Therefore, the financial industry has become one of the first scenarios where large models have been implemented.

;

;In the second half of 2023, domestic financial institutions will accelerate the layout of large models. In addition to banks, insurance companies and leading securities firms have gradually joined the "Battle of Hundreds of Models". It is worth noting that consumer finance companies have also begun to compete in the battle for large models.

;

;Incomplete statistics from researchers at Southern Weekend's New Finance Research Center show that among the 19 systemically important banks, more than half have announced that they have released large models or are in the process of intense preparations. Consumer finance companies such as Masha Consumption, Ant Financial and China Merchants Union Financial have also successively released large financial models and claim to be in a leading position.

;

;;

;

;Different financial institutions What are the similarities and differences between large models? Researchers from the Southern Weekend New Finance Research Center found that from industry practice, except for a few leading financial institutions such as Industrial and Commercial Bank of China and Agricultural Bank of China that are developing large models of the financial industry, other small and medium-sized financial institutions generally choose to cooperate with large cloud vendors. Pilot a certain business scenario.

;

;Further research by researchers from the Southern Weekend New Finance Research Center found that smart customer service has almost become a standard feature of financial institutions, such as the "smart teller" of Industrial and Commercial Bank of China, the "Bank" of China Construction Bank, and the "digital employee sisters" of Bank of Communications. "Jiaojiao" and "Xiaojiao", Jiangsu Bank's "Smart Xiaosu", etc. In addition, different financial institutions use AI technology in the fields of investment, risk control, investment consulting and investment education.

;

;From the perspective of development models, cooperation with third parties is still the mainstream model for financial institutions to develop large models. Financial institutions currently mainly cooperate with technology giants such as Baidu, Tencent, Alibaba and Huawei, as well as universities such as Tsinghua University and Peking University, as well as financial technology companies such as Hundsun Electronics and Yuxin Technology.

;

;Compared with independent research and development, cooperative research and development is relatively cost-effective. Xu Dongliang, CTO of Duxiaoman, said that training a general-purpose large model with a scale of hundreds of billions costs tens of millions per time. Earlier, some institutional media reported that GPT-4’s training time was close to 100 days, and the training cost was as high as 63 million US dollars. In other words, training can be carried out up to three times a year, and each time costs about 450 million yuan.

;

;How can small and medium-sized financial institutions implement large models? Huawei released a report titled "Digital Finance: Leading Intelligent Change and Building the Future of Digital Finance Together". It is recognized in the industry that when the number of large model parameters reaches 62 billion parameters, there will be a surge in capabilities. At present, many open source large models have directly supported parameter sets of tens of billions or even 62 billion, significantly lowering the threshold for AI training.

;

;;

;

;From a technical perspective See, pursuing large model parameter scale is not the best choice for small and medium-sized financial institutions. Although in theory, the larger the parameter scale of a large model, the stronger its capabilities, but the purpose of developing large models is to empower business and serve customers, not to show off skills. Researchers at the Southern Weekend New Finance Research Center believe that small and medium-sized financial institutions do not need to "roll out" technology. They can choose billion-level, tens of billions, or even billion-level large-scale model pilots for a certain business scenario, giving full play to the organizational flexibility advantages of small and medium-sized financial institutions.

;

;;Under the cooperation model, the two parties have great differences;

;

;With the support of AI, the digital transformation of the financial industry is accelerating, but large models have a negative impact on financial business. The empowerment needs to be further verified.

;

;Researchers from the Southern Weekend New Finance Research Center found that under the cooperation model, financial institutions are mainly concerned about three issues: first, efficiency; second, security; and third, compliance.

;

;In terms of efficiency, digital and intelligent overall solutions that integrate the front, middle and back offices are the core demands of financial institutions. In the recent Financial Street Forum, industry experts also discussed this issue. When Zhai Chenxi, former vice president of Tianfeng Securities, served as a judge for the finals of the third global financial technology application scenario competition, he pointed out that the biggest problem faced by financial institutions is that no one does the integration, resulting in inconsistent data interfaces in the front, middle and back offices, and data cannot be shared. This leads to an increase in internal communication costs to a certain extent.

;

;Researchers from Southern Weekend’s New Finance Research Center tested a number of financial institution apps and found that even in the customer service business where large models are most widely used, there are still many problems. For example, inaccurate answers, repeated answers, etc. Some can only accept "yes or no" answers and cannot understand synonymous expressions. In addition, financial institution apps use intelligent customer service to over-market, such as using robocalls to frequently harass customers.

;

;Xu Dongliang pointed out at the Financial Street Forum that when implementing large-scale financial model scenarios, five key issues still need to be addressed: first, how to choose the basic model; second, how to use the financial institution’s own business data Integrating into large models; the third is how to control model defects such as hallucination problems; the fourth is how institutions can build competition barriers when every institution will deploy large models in the future. The fifth is how to ensure the safety and compliance of the model.

;

;When it comes to security, financial institutions have large amounts of market data, transaction data, and customer data. The importance of data security and privacy protection is self-evident.

;

;He Jifeng, an academician of the Chinese Academy of Sciences, once pointed out at the 2023 INCLUSION Bund Conference that the security issues of large models are mainly the collection, use and disclosure of personal information without consent. Privacy issues may occur during the training process or during use, and the generation ability of large models diversifies the ways of "privacy leakage", making privacy protection more difficult.

;

;In terms of compliance, although cooperating with cloud service providers and purchasing their model training services is a shortcut for financial AI training, the financial industry is a highly regulated industry, and data involving key businesses is often subject to compliance pressure. And it is difficult to upload to the public cloud.

;

;Liu Jun, senior vice president of Bairong Yunchuang, also said that there are two main trends in data compliance. One is external risks, including whether data use is in compliance with laws and regulations, hackers and criminal gangs Malicious attacks, etc.; the second is internal risks, especially data leakage risks caused by operational risks.

;

;Researchers from the Southern Weekend New Finance Research Center believe that the "Interim Measures for the Management of Generative Artificial Intelligence Services" that will be implemented from August 15, 2023 balances technological development and regulatory needs and reflects the equal emphasis of legislators on encouragement and supervision. concept. It is expected that the implementation of the "Measures" will bring more legal protection and institutional innovation to the development of China's generative artificial intelligence service field.

;

;;Ecological co-construction is the way out;

;

;How can large-scale financial models that are still in the trial and promotion stage move toward industrial-level R&D applications?

;

;Hundsun Electronics’ survey found that 67% of financial institutions prefer cooperation at the application layer, and the application areas they are most concerned about are investment advisory assistants (56%), compliance and internal control (44%), and investment research (25%) ), while customer service accounts for only 10%. This is partly due to the deep application of AI in the customer service field, but more importantly, it reflects the expectations of financial institutions for large models to empower core businesses.

;

;As financial large models move toward industrial-level research and development, ecological co-construction should be emphasized. This point has been repeatedly echoed in the opinions of experts at major professional forums in 2023. For example, the 2023 China Intelligent Finance Forum even launched the "Financial Large Model Ecological Plan" on-site.

;

;Xu Dongliang believes that the industrial application of large financial models requires the joint construction and participation of scenario users (financial institutions), model providers, training tool providers and other parties.

;

;Talent is the key. At the Financial Cloud Special Session of the 2023 Tencent Global Digital Ecosystem Conference, Tencent Cloud Vice President Hu Liming pointed out that leading financial institutions are now recruiting algorithm PhDs. Although they can leverage cloud vendors, in the end financial institutions must have independent use and innovation Ability to lead the construction, optimization and continuous addition of new application scenarios for large AI platforms.

;

;Zhao Cunchao, Director of the Third Department of the North Research Platform of the R&D Center of the Agricultural Bank of China, also said that in the in-depth application of large models in the financial industry, especially in-depth applications embedded in financial scenarios, data is the core and security is the prerequisite. , computing power is the foundation, scenarios are the driving force, talents are the key, and collaboration is the guarantee.

;

;Researchers from the Southern Weekend New Finance Research Center believe that the application of large models is an irreversible long-term development trend and a key strategy to accelerate the transformation of digital finance and promote high-quality financial development. However, this is a holistic, It is a systematic and long-term project, so we cannot rush for quick success.

;

;At the same time, compliance and data security cannot be ignored. In the process of digital finance transformation, financial institutions need to be alert to compliance risks and balance the relationship between innovation and security. In data governance, clear boundaries and clear rules are the basis for consensus among all parties. Otherwise, differences will be amplified and development will be hindered.

;

;Based on this, researchers from the Southern Weekend New Finance Research Center put forward three suggestions: First, promote "industry-university-research" collaboration. Strengthen peer and cross-sector exchanges and cooperation, formulate standards, standardize processes, and create and share together. The second is to speed up legislation. The European Artificial Intelligence Law has been implemented, and the draft of the Chinese version of the Artificial Intelligence Law is also under review. The third is to attach importance to talent cultivation. Talent reserves restrict the implementation of AI development, because not only early-stage R&D requires professional talents, but later-stage operations and maintenance also require talents.

;

;The official website of the Ministry of Education shows: Representatives of the People's Congress proposed "About changing the physical education subject from a minor subject to a main subject, and providing free distribution to primary school students" Physical Education Textbook Suggestions”. The Ministry of Education responded: There is no priority among the subjects prescribed in the national curriculum plan. Each subject has its own unique educational value and cannot be substituted for each other. At the same time, each subject cooperates with each other to educate students collaboratively to ensure the achievement of training goals. Physical education and health courses are an important part of the basic education curriculum system.

;

;In the reply from the Ministry of Education, "there is no distinction between primary and secondary subjects" avoiding the distinction between major subjects and minor subjects; the statement that "each subject has its unique educational value" is also correct. However, it is still necessary to discuss the common understanding of what is a major subject and what is a minor subject. As far as primary schools are concerned, the main subjects generally recognized by the public are nothing more than Chinese, mathematics and foreign languages, and the minor subjects are nothing more than physical education, art and music. There are two specific criteria for classification: first, teaching time, the main subject generally has more teaching time than minor subjects; second, the main subject will have a closed-book examination, and the results will be included in the total score of the mid-term, final and entrance exams to become an outstanding student or to be promoted. The standards of a good school. The latter criterion is more commonly used.

;

;The "Compulsory Education Curriculum Plan and Curriculum Standards (2022 Edition)" stipulates that the proportion of total class hours in nine years is 20%-22% for Chinese, which is very high, 13%-15% for mathematics, and 13%-15% for foreign languages. 6%-8%, physical education and health 10%-11%, exceeding foreign languages, science or physics, chemistry 8%-10%, according to the Ministry of Education, this proportion, "higher than the United States , Australia, Germany, Russia, South Korea, Japan, Finland, the United Kingdom, Canada and other countries."

;

;So, from the perspective of teaching time, physical education is already the main subject in the compulsory education stage.

;

;Since the primary promotion from primary school to junior high school is mainly based on interviews and admissions to the nearest "good junior high school" and admission by lottery, there is no unified examination for primary school to junior high school. In this sense, it seems meaningless to talk about major subjects and minor subjects at the primary school level. Because there are no exams. However, there are also some good schools that conduct the so-called "secret test" or resume + interview to obtain good students. Of course, the test is still on traditional cultural subjects or main subjects such as language and mathematics, and will not test physical education. In this sense, primary schools Stage physical education is a minor subject.

;

;However, junior high school is very different. Physical education must be included in the total score of the high school entrance examination. The original intention is to make children pay attention to sports. The score is not low. Under one physical education subject, there are many test items, which is essentially equivalent to taking several tests. In order to get high scores or even perfect scores, schools and parents force children to take exams, which increases the academic burden instead of reducing it. "Junior high school students in the gym" have even become a strange sight.

;

;Especially parents in urban areas spend a lot of money to hire private tutors for their children, which has led to a skyrocketing fee for various sports coaches. This essentially requires junior high school students to be trained according to athlete standards. Extensive training and overtraining have resulted in a large number of sports injuries for children, such as knee meniscus injuries, which is detrimental to children's physical health, growth and development, and is contrary to physical fitness. The positioning of fitness.

;

;Because mass sports and competitive sports are completely different things.

;

;Popular sports are suitable for everyone. They are designed to allow the body to have necessary activities, to allow muscles to exercise, move the muscles and bones, and strengthen the body. Even if you participate in certain ball games or track and field events, the level of It is also amateur-level; at the same time, exercisers can breathe fresh air outdoors, establish a connection with nature, and repair their body and mind; it is also often a social activity that meets the need for interactive connections with others and helps promote mental health.

;

;Competitive sports are played by a very small number of people with athletic talent. They are essentially a breakthrough in the limits of human physical ability. Among many competitive sports, many commercially successful industries and profit models have emerged. Including selling tickets + selling broadcast rights + advertising endorsements, etc., the income of top sports stars is very high; large-scale events such as the Olympics are participated in by countries and regions, and they have a higher meaning. Athletes winning medals are regarded as bringing glory to the country.

;

;It can be seen that the sports for students in ordinary primary and secondary schools should be a type of mass sports, which allows students to go outdoors more and strengthen their bodies. It is best to have their own favorite projects and get the benefits from sports. Fun and spiritual joy, under the blue sky and sun, soothing the body and mind and cultivating the spirit, this is something everyone can do. Children who are talented in sports and are interested in making a career in competitive sports can enter specialized sports schools to bring out their talents and potential. Being physically strong is only a very basic requirement. In short, the two types of schools have completely different requirements for student physical education.

;

;If physical education is included in the total score of mid-term and final exams at the primary school level and becomes the so-called "main subject", it will only be counterproductive. Working hard to train in events you don’t like in order to get high scores. Overtraining and improper training often lead to sports injuries. Physical education classes will become hard labor and children will not feel the joy of sports.

;

;Nowadays, recess has this tendency. It was originally intended to allow children more time to exercise, but many schools insist on making it ritualistic, pursuing uniformity and grandeur. Instead, children view recess as a daunting prospect. Sports activities should be relaxing and fun, so that they can exercise the body and mind. Fun, meaningful physical activity is itself a natural medicine for maintaining and promoting mental health.

;

;Nowadays, many children have psychological problems. One of the reasons is that families and schools force children to take exams in knowledge education, and parents neglect character education and values ​​education for their children. The second reason is that children generally need to Strengthen the cultivation of physical and mental repair mechanisms and habits. In fact, what children now lack is not physical activity time, but physical activity time that is fun, meaningful, can release their nature, and can soothe the body and mind.

;

;As for the high school entrance examinations in ordinary junior high schools, it is the right direction for various places to change the physical education examination from a merit-based examination to a standard examination in 2022, so that children do not need to work hard on the physical education examination items, consume too much or even Destroy your own body just for high scores; only specialized sports schools need to select the best to stimulate the talents of good talents and continue to work towards challenging the limits of human physical fitness.

;

;Recently, two counties in Bazhong, Sichuan have banned citizens from smoking bacon privately and required them to smoke bacon at designated centralized smoking points. Officials The response was to prevent air pollution. To ban a traditional food preparation method and folk custom that has lasted for more than a thousand years on the grounds of environmental protection is to ignore the traditional rights of the people and is even suspected of rent-seeking.

;

;Tongjiang and Nanjiang counties in Bazhong, Sichuan, have recently issued notices prohibiting self-smoking of pickled products in urban areas. Those who need to smoke must go to designated centralized smoking points for smoking. Violators may be fined. There is a service charge for curing bacon at centralized smoking sites, and of the two centralized smoking sites announced in Tongjiang County, one clearly states that it only smokes meat products purchased from the company. The officially designated centralized smoking point is suspected of administrative monopoly and profit transfer, which has attracted great attention on the Internet.

;

;On November 23, the Tongjiang County Comprehensive Law Enforcement Bureau responded that smoking bacon during the winter festival is a local custom, but the smoke produced during smoking seriously affects the ambient air quality. In order to improve the urban ambient air quality, Eliminate safety hazards and therefore set up centralized smoking points. The response also stated that the statement in the original notice that a centralized smoking site only smoked meat products purchased from the company reflected lax control and work errors. After consultation with the company, the smoking site was opened to the public. Staff of the Nanjiang County Comprehensive Law Enforcement Bureau also told the media that they have paid attention to the online discussion, and leaders are meeting to study it, and the results will be announced to the public.

;

;Not only Tongjiang and Nanjiang counties, but also Bazhou District, Jingkai District, Enyang District and other places in Bazhong City have also previously designated 10 bacon smoking sites. In October, due to the frequent occurrence of bacon smoking, which resulted in insufficient performance of air pollution prevention and control work, four local sub-district office principals were interviewed and reported to the whole district.

;

;Bacon has a long history. Legend has it that bacon was available during the battle between Huangdi and Chi You, and there are records of bacon in classics such as "The Book of Changes", "The Analects of Confucius" and "Book of Rites". Sichuan smoked bacon also has a history of one or two thousand years. Originally, bacon was made to extend the preservation time of meat, but now, bacon has become an important folk custom. For many Sichuan people, bacon is the taste of home and the New Year.

;

;Many places in Sichuan have their own signature bacon products, such as Qingchengshan bacon, Guangyuan Qingchuan bacon, Liangshan Mianning bacon, Beichuan bacon, and Dazhou bacon, all of which are famous local specialties. In 2013, the former Ministry of Agriculture approved the implementation of agricultural product geographical indication protection for “Wanyuan Old Bacon” in Dazhou, Sichuan. However, as efforts to control smog intensify, many places in Sichuan have banned the traditional method of smoking bacon, and many local specialty products are facing the dilemma of disappearing.

;

;Smoking bacon is a custom that has been passed down for thousands of years, but now it has to be stopped because of "polluting the air". Is this reasonable? Even if smoked bacon does cause air pollution, but people tolerate it, is it necessary for the government to ban it across the board?

;

;How much impact smoked bacon has on air quality requires scientific evaluation. Did smoking bacon bring down the air quality of the entire city? Or is there actually another more important factor in air pollution, and bacon is just a scapegoat?

;

;In addition, how much pollution can centralized smoking reduce compared with private smoking? According to the official statement, dedicated smokehouses have been built at centralized smoking sites and are equipped with corresponding environmental protection equipment to reduce pollution. So, how much pollution can centralized smoking reduce? Do environmentally friendly equipment really work?

;

;Also, just banning self-smoked meat in urban areas, how much impact can it have on environmental protection? In the county, many people's hometowns are in the countryside. If fumigation is not allowed in the city, then go back to your hometown and the countryside to smoke. Wouldn't it also cause pollution?

;

;The mandatory centralized smoking and the charging of service fees will undoubtedly increase the cost of smoked meat for citizens. Although officials say that centralized smoking points only charge cost fees, because centralized smoking points are designated and there is no market competition at all, the owners of centralized smoking points will inevitably tend to charge more. In the process of formulating smoking sites, whether there is rent-seeking or not is also a matter of public concern.

;

;If the traditional method of smoking bacon is indeed seriously polluted, it is not impossible to properly manage it. However, management does not prohibit self-smoking meat across the board, nor can smoking points be determined in a designated way. In fact, not only large-scale smoking companies can build special smokehouses and add environmental protection facilities such as smoke filtration to reduce pollution, but small smokeless and environmentally friendly bacon smoking machines have also been available for a long time. As early as 2018, a smokeless and environmentally friendly bacon smoking machine appeared in Chongqing.

;

;According to testing by the Chongqing Ecological Environment Testing Center, using this environmentally friendly smoker, the concentration of particulate matter in the air has been reduced from 400 to 500 mg per cubic meter in traditional open smokers to about 3 mg. It has been reduced from 40 mg per cubic meter to about 0.6 mg. Such a small smoking machine only sells for 20,000 to 30,000 yuan, and ordinary merchants can buy it to smoke bacon for customers. It is even possible for someone to buy one by themselves or in partnership. Although the smoking machine requires a certain cost, the sealed machine can reduce the spread of smoke and reduce the use of wood to a certain extent. Taken together, it is not much more expensive than the traditional open smoking method.

;

;In 2015, Chongqing City also banned citizens from smoking bacon in the name of environmental protection, which also caused a lot of controversy. After the successful development of a smokeless and environmentally friendly smoking machine, citizens' demand for smoked bacon has been met, and air pollution has been greatly reduced, getting the best of both worlds.

;

;At present, environmental protection is a very important task of the government. However, environmental protection should not come at the expense of public convenience and traditional customs. In the past, some places banned the burning of coal for heating in rural areas in winter, and instead used natural gas or electricity for heating. But even with government subsidies, the cost of heating is still much higher than burning coal, and farmers are overwhelmed. In some places, farmers have even been stripped of their firewood stoves and are not allowed to burn firewood, only gas. In some places, people are prohibited from burning paper money during sacrifices, and it is prohibited to burn paper houses, paper horses and other traditional funeral objects. These have caused great controversy.

;

;The environmental protection government has KPIs, but they cannot override folk customs and people's livelihood. After all, talents are the measure of all things. The government's environmental policies and measures must fully consider the lives of ordinary people and should not grossly interfere with people's living habits and interrupt thousands of years of traditional folk customs.
